channel.title: Course Overview on Data Science for Biotechnology
channel.description: Recent content in Course Overview on Data Science for Biotechnology

item.title: About Us
item.description: About Us Sook-Hee Evans Sejal Dua Sook-Hee Evans is a senior at Tufts University majoring in Data Science and minoring in Engineering Management. She previously interned at Amazon Robotics on the Human-Computer Interaction team, where she built a tool used to find errors in the state machines of robotic workcells, and to help developers visualize the state machine flow. In her free time, Sook-Hee enjoys swimming, cooking, playing Wii with her housemates, and listening to podcasts.

item.title: Cool Companies
item.description: Cool & Relevant Companies NOTE: we are not sponsoring these companies in any way, shape, or form. This is just to help and hopefully inspire people to dip their toe into the field. Illumina Benevolent AI Novo Nordisk Corti AI Reverie Labs Buoy Health Siligon Therapeutics

item.title: Course Schedule
item.description: Course Schedule Unit 1: Data Science Fundamentals Week 1: Introduction to the Course [February 1, 2021] Week 2: Exploratory Data Analysis [February 8, 2021] Week 3: Data Visualization [February 16, 2021 (fake Monday)] Guest Speaker: Megan Monroe Week 4: Neural Networks [February 22, 2021] Guest Speaker: Soha Hassoun Unit 2: Breakthroughs in Biotech Week 5: Imaging & Diagnostics [March 1, 2021] Guest Speaker: Fiorenzo Omenetto Week 6: Natural Language Processing for Scientific Research [March 8, 2021] Guest Speaker: Nicolai Frost Jacobsen (Corti AI) Week 7: Feature Engineering for Drug Discovery [March 15, 2021] Week 8: Genetic Algorithms and Sequencing [March 22, 2021] Week 9: Decision Trees for Drug Development / Discovery [March 29, 2021] Unit 3: Becoming a Practitioner Week 10: Data Ethics, Cybersecurity, and Social Justice [April 5, 2021] Guest Speaker: Ming Chow Week 11: Finding Applications Around You [April 12, 2021] Guest Speaker: Andrew Dumit (Buoy Health) Week 12: Roadblocks, Pipelines, and Scalability [April 26, 2021] Week 13: Final Class Presentations [May 3, 2021]

item.title: Datasets
item.description: Datasets Healthcare / Medicine / Biotech Realm Pfizer Vaccine Tweets COVID-19 Open Research Dataset Challenge (CORD-19) Novel Corona Virus 2019 Dataset Heart Disease UCI Chest X-Ray Images (Pneumonia) NeurIPS 2020: Data Science for COVID-19 (DS4C) Miscellaneous Datasets that you can load with Python 1.88 million US Wildfires Spotify Dataset 1921-2020, 160k+ Tracks 120 years of Olympic History: Athletes and Results Interesting Data to Visualize Plotly Datasets (CSV)

item.title: Homework
item.description: Homework «««< HEAD «««< HEAD You will get out what you put into this course. Homework is not meant to cause stress or burnout. It is simply used as a time to roam freely as you engage with the material. In order to account for the fact that we are all at various experience levels, homeworks will be progressive in nature. You should aim to tackle the first few items listed on each homework page.

item.title: Week 1
item.description: Week 1: Introduction to the Course Required: Create a Github account and email us your username (we will add you to our DS4B organization on GitHub) Once you are added to the GitHub DS4B organization, create a new repository (within the organization) for your DS4B coursework. Name it <first name>-<last name>. Click the “Add a README file” button when initializing the repo. Make the repository private. Clone the repository on your local machine.

item.title: Week 1
item.description: Week 1: Introduction to the Course Required: Create a Github account and email us your username (we will add you to our DS4B organization on GitHub) Once you are added to the GitHub DS4B organization, create a new repository (within the organization) for your DS4B coursework. Name it <first name>-<last name>. Click the “Add a README file” button when initializing the repo. Make the repository private. Clone the repository on your local machine.

item.title: Week 1
item.description: Week 1: Introduction to the Course Links Data Science vs. Computer Science Jamboard Biotechnology Jamboard Jupyter Notebook Setup Creating a GitHub Repository Kaggle Datasets Creating a Simple Linear Regression using sklearn Jupyter Notebook Installation OPTION 1: Anaconda > Jupyter Notebooks $ conda install -c conda-forge notebook OPTION 2: If you already have Python installed, you can use a software management tool called pip. $ pip3 install jupyter OR
